intro: Trochocephalus olivieri, commonly known as the olive tree of Madagascar, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are often used in local cuisines. Its botanical features include a slender trunk and compound leaves, making it a distinctive species within its native habitat. It plays an important ecological role in the ecosystems of Madagascar.
